description: Obtained from sequence of lucky numbers (A000959) by taking iterated absolute value differences of terms and extracting the leading diagonal.
comments: The classical Gilbreath-Proth Conjecture is that when iterated absolute differences are formed from the sequence of primes, the leading diagonal is 2,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,... (see A036262). This is an analog for the lucky numbers sequence.a(n) = A254967(n,0). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 11 2015
references: H. W. Gould, Gilbreath-Proth type sequence generated from Lucky numbers, unpublished.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
prog: (Haskell)a054978 n = a054978_list !! na054978_list = map head $ iterate               (\lds -> map abs $ zipWith (-) (tail lds) lds) a000959_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 10 2015
author: _Henry Gould_, May 29 2000
